parts.instructions: Complete the sentences below. Use NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS from the listening for each answer.

questions.prompt: _______ is what allows cell phone thieves to succeed.
Pickpockets like stealing in busy ________, so be extra aware in these places.
People leaving subway stations often have their cell phones stolen when they look to see if they have a _________.
People should consult their _________ to find out how to switch on the security features available on their cell phones.
If your cell phone is stolen, the police have to know more than its __________ and colour if they are to get it back to you.

parts.instructions: Complete the summary below on the Kenyan flower industry. Write NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS from the listening for each answer.

questions.prompt: The Kenyan flower industry is Kenya’s largest after ________ and tea and has increased by 31% over the last 5 years.
Originally started to contribute to British East Africa’s ________, it continued to flourish after independence due to its geographical position and variety of climate conditions.
Economic advantages, such as beneficial ________ have kept costs low and good logistics have been set up to service world flower markets.
Labour and energy costs are also low and there is no ________ on European exports from Kenya.

Floriculture is Kenya’s 2nd highest foreign exchange earner and it generates plenty of ________ for Kenya’s public economy - 50,000 to 70,000 people are employed directly and 1½ million people indirectly.

parts.instructions: Complete the table below on problems and criticisms of the Kenyan flower industry. Write NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS from the listening for each answer.

questions.prompt: High oil prices: Increased ________ costs
Competition: Competition getting fiercer due to the numbers of roses produced and better ________ from the competition.
Water usage: Lakes have declined in level and ________
Pollution: Attempts at improvement by increasing the price of ________ and other regulatory measures - political and tribal issues have resisted these attempted efforts.
Outdated Farm methods: More organic ways of ________ are being used.

parts.instructions: Complete the flow chart that summarises the cotton growing process. Use NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS from the listening for each answer.

questions.prompt: Planting - seeds planted at a fixed depths and ________.
Weed Control - weeds can affect yields. Addressed with close cultivation and seeds planted deep into ________ - weeds high and dry.
Insect Management - Insects can destroy the crop - some plants compensate by producing more ________.
Irrigation - Cotton very efficient with water: cotton generates more ________ for 1 gallon of water than other US crops.
Harvesting - This must be done before bad weather comes. It’s done by ________ in the US - stripper harvesters and spindle pickers used.
Storage - After quality assessment, cotton sold or stored. If stored in a government- approved warehouse, it can be used as security for a ________.
Cottonseed - byproduct from the cotton crop. Used as salad oil or high ________ animal feed.
